meaningMnemonic: This word looks like a verb but it's not (sorry!). It's an adverb. The kanji itself means <kanji>certain</kanji> and the vocab version means all sorts of variations on that: <vocabulary>surely</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>certainly</vocabulary>, and <vocabulary>without exception</vocabulary> to name a few.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

Ra, the Egyptian god asks you: "Can you do it? Are you <vocabulary>certain</vocabulary> you can build the pyramids?" 

"Yes I <reading>can ra</reading> (かなら). Yes I can," you reply.
